title: Authorizes health insurers to provide actuarially appropriate reductions in health insurance premiums for participation in a wellness program
summary: Authorizes health insurers, subject to the approval of the superintendent of insurance, to provide actuarially appropriate reductions in health insurance premiums for an enrollee's or insured's participation in a wellness program (defined); provides for the appointment of an advisory committee on wellness to be co-chaired by the commissioner of health and the superintendent of insurance and to report on the development and effectiveness of wellness programs.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to making actuarially appropriate reductions in health insurance premiums in return for an enrollee's or insured's participation in a bona fide wellness program; and to establish an advisory committee on wellness to report thereon
